{"step_by_step_thinking": "The question is asking about a cyst that is found within the bone at the junction of the globular process, the Lateral nasal process & maxillary process. The globulomaxillary cyst is a type of cyst that is located between the roots of the maxillary canine and lateral incisor. The naso-alveolar cyst is a non-odontogenic cyst that occurs in the nasal alveolar process. The naso palatine cyst is the most common non-odontogenic cyst and it occurs in the midline of the palate. The mid palatine cyst is a rare cyst that occurs in the midline of the hard palate.
